results.title: The Junk playground
results.creator_credit: Sune Lund-Sorensen, Kortfilmradet and Laterna Film
results.brief_description: A playground is an environment forming its occupants through the challenge with which it confronts them and through the chances it gives them to take up these challenges. The documentary is about a couple of junk playgrounds in or near Copenhagen.
results.description: A playground is an environment forming its occupants through the challenge with which it confronts them and through the chances it gives them to take up these challenges. The documentary is about a couple of junk playgrounds in or near Copenhagen.

results.title: The Jungle book: a lesson in accepting change
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Concerns the story of a young boy faced with the dilema of moving away from the place he has grown up in. Incorporates the analogy of the young boy brought up by wolves in the Jungle Book story. Interesting combination of live scenes between the boy and his uncle, indispersed with the animated sequences.

results.title: The Jungle book
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, Edward S. Feldman, Raju Patel and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A faithful adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s classic tale of Moglie the jungle boy who is raised by wolves after being lost when a tiger attacked an encampment and killed his father. Years later he finds himself re-united with his childhood love Kitty and back in the “civilization” of Colonial India which he finds far less civilized then his jungle haunts. The search for a lost treasure shows who the truly civilized members of society are. Cast includes Jason Scott Lee, Cary Elwes, Lena Headey, Sam Neill, John Cleese, Jason Flemyng.

results.title: The Jungle and the plough
results.brief_description: This film shows the work of UNESCO/Ceylon Government Fundamental Education Project at Minneriya in Ceylon. At this centre, men are trained for work in the villages, including the teaching of better farming methods, the stimulation of local industries, health education and adult education. The emphasis in teaching is on a sympathetic approach and pictorial illustration.

results.title: The Juggling movie
results.creator_credit: Patrick Melly and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Shows three jugglers instructing children in the skills of juggling and then performing a comic juggling routine in front of an audience. Features the Pickle Family Jugglers (Larry Pisoni, Peggy Snider, Cecil McKinnon). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Juggler of Notre Dame
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of Anatole France’s story of a juggler named Barnaby who is given shelter in a monastery. To start with, the seemingly worthless Barnaby and his antics displease the monks, but one night his juggling causes a miracle, and the monks realise the worth of Barnaby and his talent. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
